an4.237:4.1: “Mendicants, I declare these four kinds of deeds, having realized them with my own insight.
an4.237:4.3: 1. There are dark deeds with dark result;
an4.237:4.5: • dark and bright deeds with dark and bright results; and
an4.237:4.6: • neither dark nor bright deeds with neither dark nor bright results, which lead to the end of deeds.
an4.237:5.1: And what are the dark deeds with dark results?
an4.237:5.2: It’s when someone makes hurtful choices by way of body, speech, and mind. These are called dark deeds with dark results.
an4.237:6.1: And what are bright deeds with bright results?
an4.237:6.2: It’s when someone makes pleasing choices by way of body, speech, and mind. These are called bright deeds with bright results.
an4.237:7.1: And what are dark and bright deeds with dark and bright results?
an4.237:7.2: It’s when someone makes both hurtful and pleasing choices by way of body, speech, and mind. These are called dark and bright deeds with dark and bright results.
an4.237:8.1: And what are neither dark nor bright deeds with neither dark nor bright results, which lead to the end of deeds?
an4.237:8.2: Right view, right motivation, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right samādhi.
an4.237:8.3: These are called neither dark nor bright deeds with neither dark nor bright results, which lead to the end of deeds.
an4.237:8.4: These are the four kinds of deeds that I declare, having realized them with my own insight.”
